title: Earthships: Off-Grid Living from Garbage
description: A 60-second lesson on Earthships: Off-Grid Living from Garbage.

hook.text: Michael Reynolds builds houses from old tires, bottles, and cans. They need no heating, cooling, or utility bills.

buildup.text: Earthships use thermal mass from tire walls, passive solar design, and rainwater harvesting to be fully self-sufficient.

discovery.text: A tire packed with earth absorbs heat during the day and releases it at night â€” natural climate control.

twist.text: Reynolds was stripped of his architecture license for building code violations. He kept building anyway.

climax.text: Earthships prove that sustainability can mean using less technology, not more â€” working with nature instead.

punchline.text: The greenest house on Earth is built from garbage.

quiz.question: What makes Earthships self-sufficient?
options: Thermal mass from tires, passive solar design, and rainwater harvesting
